Name: Miyagi Labs
Headline: AI to transform YouTube content into interactive courses
Description:
Miyagi Labs is an AI-powered platform that transforms videos from content creators and professors into complete, interactive courses.

YouTube is one of the best educational resources in the world, but it lacks the tools to turn passive watching into active learning. By making course creation as simple as uploading a video, we’re building Shopify for online education, empowering content creators and educators to transform their knowledge into engaging, interactive learning experiences.

We automatically generate high-quality courses—in under an hour—that people actually complete. On our platform, learners engage with short-answer and multiple-choice questions, as well as quizzes, receiving instant feedback and support from an AI voice tutor if they need more help.
Tags: industry:education; industry:generative-ai; industry:saas; industry:video; industry:media; location:new-york

Active_Founders.Name: Guang Cui, Founder
Active_Founders.Description: Helping students learn better. Building Miyagi Labs, where we turn videos into complete and interactive courses. I'm originally from Maryland and studied computer science at MIT. I love music and ninja warrior.

Active_Founders.Name: Tyrone Davis III, Founder
Active_Founders.Description:
Co-Founder of Miyagi Labs

Previously founded the nonprofit The Gift of Chess and grew it to become the largest chess charity in the world spreading chess education. Led donations of over 100,000+ chess sets to partner schools, clubs, refugee centers, orphanages and prisons. I'm from NYC and studied computer science at MIT.

generated_description:
Miyagi Labs is on a mission to revolutionize the educational landscape by transforming YouTube videos into interactive courses. Launched in 2025 and part of Y Combinator's W25 batch, this New York-based startup aims to make learning active rather than passive. The vision is simple: harness the wealth of knowledge found on YouTube and provide tools that allow creators—educators, professors, and influencers alike—to easily convert their video content into structured, engaging learning experiences.

Think of Miyagi Labs as the Shopify for online education. By enabling course creation to be as easy as uploading a video, it empowers users to deliver educational content that's not just watched but completed. The platform automatically generates high-quality, interactive courses in less than an hour, complete with quizzes, short-answer questions, and AI-driven feedback to support learners.

The company is a small team of two, backed by Harj Taggar as their Group Partner. Their unique approach sits at the intersection of education, generative AI, and software as a service, and they’ve tagged themselves in a variety of relevant sectors including media and video.

Currently, they provide a platform where users can browse an array of courses created by their favorite YouTube educators and professors. With functionality that allows professors to convert lecture materials into courses or creators to expand their content into full-fledged educational experiences, Miyagi Labs is opening doors for innovative learning methods. 

For anyone interested in exploring their offerings or becoming part of this learning journey, you can check out their website at [miyagilabs.ai](https://miyagilabs.ai). It’s where education meets technology, born out of a vision to make learning interactive and engaging for everyone.
